reviewText: I am a sucker for this type of programming. The sites and sounds are addictive. With nothing but garbage on network tv, this is a breath of fresh air. Keep them coming Amazon!

Having dove the Galapagos Islands, and at Darwin's Arch in particular.  I loved the video and the documentary done on the whale sharks and other sea life that one encounters at this remote dive site.  Sharing this video with my other dive buddies.
Learned more about whale sharks from this presentation than I ever knew before watching it.
Great movie with lots of sharks and lots of pretty fish and even some of the animals/evolution on the galapagos islands. Learned a lot about whale sharks which was tons of fun.
Very good show about what is being done to study the whale sharks and the Galapagos islands.  Still more research needs to be done, but that's usually the case when it comes to something like this.
A very interesting documentary...enjoyed by the entire family.
Good footage, narration nearly killed me

The forced sensationalism; dramatic music, cut fades, and overly produced narration. This is why the BBC and Nature and PBS dominate you. An American produced Documentary is allowed to be calming and inspiring. Let the viewer gage nature and wonder, spew some facts, be thought-provoking, Honestly, this is some of the best footage ever captured but, it is ruined by the overproduction. The art of being subtle is more valuable than appealing to the lowest-common-denominator.

Being a diver myself this is the type of documentary that reignites my love for the open water.  The only thing is I don't believe in the whole world being millions of years old theory and like most documentaries about the earth etc that's what they push.  That aside, the footage was incredible, the study was fascinating.
Very cool and educational video.  I love the underwater world
prevent tracking of animals- if you love animals- leave them alone- do not watch these types of films- no "research" is worth it

We were looking for an interesting shark video for Shark Week and our Ocean Unit Study for homeschooling. Information was repeated throughout the video. The narrator does have a very low monotone type of voice which can make you a bit sleepy. I feel like the video left us wanting with very little informational questions that they posed answered. Where do the whale sharks give birth!? It does give bits of information about other animals in the sea pretty randomly through the video. Gives much information about how researchers were going about their work of tracking the animals. It was only okay.

It was just very low budget.  Of course the subject is fascinating, the narrator was uninspiring, the graphics could be made by anyone using GoogleEarth (which is not to say that inherently makes them bad, but they were relatively uninformative and not aesthetically pleasing), and there could have been much more material covered than this single research team (not that they were uninteresting, but documentaries should present a greater breadth in their material)/

Beautiful footage of divers chasing after elusive whale sharks to tag and study them. I was fascinated by how much we still need to understand of the migratory, mating, and birthing habits of whale sharks. Up to 300 young...just mind-blowing.
Great way to discover this amazing creature, what a huge and amazing shark!.....We had the chance do dive with that beauty for some years, see that clip :)
Great footage of the whale sharks in the Galapagos!!
Lots of great information on the whale shark that many people didn't even know existed until recently.  A must watch for shark lovers.
I liked it a lot except that I do not believe the evolution in it
Very informative.  I know so little about whale sharks.
Great, informative program. Have watched parts of it twice.
Great shots of beautiful sharks and other sea creatures.
found it to be quite  interesting; great photography. >>

I thoroughly enjoyed the experience of this journalistic visually artistic production.  The photography, commentary, feeling, editing and overall everything has filled me with amazement.  I have watched it twice and can guarantee that I will watch it again.

Very well done, interesting, informative and not too long for a documentary. On a side note, happened to watch this late on one of those sleepless nights and it did the trick, what a way to relax and unwind. Who would ever guess watching giant sharks at 2:00am would help you sleep.

Whale sharks are awesome.  The video is good and informative.  For some reason, the background music is so loud in places that it was hard to really hear the words that were being spoken.  So, I guess I'm rating it lower because of the production, not the material.  If you like whale sharks, watch the video!!

Rare footage of giant sharks that make the Galapagos a stop on their itinerary. This species has been around for several million years but not much is known about them.  The team of divers were working to install radio identification floats on the sharks so that scientists could follow them on their migrations.  The huge sharks did not seem to be interested in attacking the men, but allowed them to swim alongside and harpoon monitors into their backs or fins (ouch!). They never flinched and never seemed to be in any hurry but swam slowly and steadily on their way.
We are planning a trip to the Galapagos and we are trying to learn all that we can about the area.  It was very informative and beautifully filmed.
movie of life in the sea is fun to watch. the sea life of whales and fish.
Very well done.  I really enjoyed this, especially having just returned from the Galápagos!
I have great admiration for these folks!!!
The underwater photography was amazing. Little else is known about the life history of this elusive giant and this documentary provided plenty of scientific data.
"A fool says in his heart that there is no God." Take the time to enjoy the beautiful things of this world and give credit to its Creator. Amazing. My 3 years old daughter wants to go there.
I love the content, but the soft monotone speaker makes you extremely sleepy
Great documentary with vivid beautiful video
Excellent narration, beautifully filmed.  It's not often that a film of this nature is able to keep our family riveted from start to finish but this one did.  Highly recommended.
Very well done and interesting for all ages
This video was very informative, great shots of the whale sharks and good commentary!
It was so tranquil watching human beings interact with such gentle giants!
Such great footage of the whale sharks, amazing!
Could not watch...graphic told me the video was not available.
I loved it. It maybe could have been trimmed a bit since it was a little repetitive but still thoroughly enjoyable.
did not know about these sharks.
Very educational, enjoyed learning about whale and hammerhead  sharks and facts about the Galapagos islands.
A beautiful place, scenary is an eye opener to all of mankind that we have the duty to protect every living creature on our planet and maintain their habitat.
Amazing photography. This show rekindled our interest in taking a trip to the Galapagos.
I found it to be very interesting..
Very vivid pictures. The footage seamed kind of fishy to me!
Love watching anything with our beautiful creatures living in the sea
The most whale shark footage I've seen in any documentry. So great to see them get the air time they deserve.

Poorly composed, doesn't stay on topic and shifts abruptly to talking about other things (iguanas, etc) without anything to explain why it's talking about them now. Footage is all right, but there are much better documentaries about the same or similar subjects out there.
Not enough ninjas, explosions or underwater spy bases. Very boring underwater documentary...
It was so well done. It made me realize how hard it is to learn about these giant whale sharks. It was beautiful to watch.
Kind of boring- not covering new territory

Very informative about whale sharks and I never knew they could grow to be that large.  The cinematography was excellent and captured what it is like at the Galapagos Islands where these sharks evidently come to give birth.

Real good documentary.  My wife and I traveled to the Galapagos in 2005 with Elderhostel (now Road Scholar).  Saw lots of wildlife on land, but no sharks. A very interesting place, unlike anything you've seen.
Educational, wow, beautiful picture of water views, etc.  I enjoy anything to do with the ocean.  Very interesting!!!
pictures of island and the uniqueness of the astonishing changing sea current was worth the watch
Very interesting program. Beautifully filmed. Appropriate for all ages.

This is my thing man (and women......).  There were slow parts, but out of roughly 56 minutes, 45 were excellent.  The size of "whale sharks" are enormous and when watching people swimming next to this creature you cannot resist imaging yourself in the water as well......
Could not get good picture, always had writing shadows or something on most of the film I watched.
This was eye opening and interesting.
Excellent eye candy, a little over the top in the drama aspect.  Definitely worth the watch for the beautiful cinematography.
Amazing documentary! My kids are obsessed with marine life and they love this documentary.
Great documentary! Makes me want to visit the Galpagos Islands.
It's beautiful to watch and shows you a great perfection of the oceans life.
It was good but not very insightful.
Great photograph of these gentle giants in the Galapagos and beyond.
This was a quality and educational video.
I really enjoyed it and learned a lot as well.
Great show, wished it was longer
Even the kids were intrigued and sat down to watch this show. Nature documentaries usually rate high with our family.
Whale sharks are cool and not well understood. Good documentary.
Excelent documentary. It is also relaxing and peaceful.
Loved it. High quality shots of some amazing undersea life in high resolution.
Well done; held my interest through out.

It may be just that I'm a sucker for undersea adventures, but this film held my fascination throughout. I'm sure the divers were disappointed even as I was that we couldn't witness a live birth of  giant shark. Still, the footage was splendid and I learned much about how scientists go about their exploration of the deep sea. One thing that held my attention was the narrator's wonderment about the reason behind the shark's behavior. I feel more familiar about the subject of food fish and the varieties of them and their place in the food chain. It amazes me how nature keeps these things in balance. One curiosity that remains is how the divers determined the age of the shark and what gave each one it's particular identifying marks. I have a profound respect for the mysteries of the deep and am so pleased to view the beauty of it.
Overall very good. Very informative , good video. The soundtrack had issues though.  The volume level changes.
Awesome. I loved it especially after just being there.
We loved this movie about whale sharks and other animals!
Very interesting documentary about these animals-- and insightful.
Beautiful documentary about this great animals, I wish it gave more explanation. It's a bit slow but beautiful
Magical - I have watched probably 5 times so far!
A spectacular show that is as informative as it is beautiful! Well worth your time to enjoy.
Just put it on to fall asleep
Galapagos was truly an exceedingly interesting informative movie, very enjoyable
We sat with the 8 year old, and I think us adults learned just as much as the kid! Loved the filming and educational aspect of the show.  Was very interesting.
It was just so interesting to see how intelligent these mammals are. Definitely enjoyed by mt parents who are from that region of the world.
Very informative video about these gentle giant
Spectacular pictures of whale and hammerhead sharks. Nothing much new is learned, but watching these giant sharks offers its own reward. 4 stars
great documentary, very infotmative learned many new things, that i was unaware of.
Loved it; tells  the story of the nomadic species the Whale Shark and Man's continued fascination with the species and why they gather at the Galapagos Island at a certain time of the year.

Nature at its best. A very enlightening program about the Whale Sharks travel.ione day maybe they will learn more about their birthing locations and actually record and document this amazing animals life cycle .
it is interesting that how this creature lives.
There are better shark shows out there.
Great production value.  My boys loved it.
amazing how far them sharks travel. love it
Production seemed antiquated and maybe that was the intent?
Great photography; fascinating information; presentation made it work to stay involved.
My children and I enjoyed watching this show together. It is beautifully shot and gives great information on Whale Sharks.
Everything you ever wanted to know about whale sharks.
It's a great film. I would put that place on my bucket list'
Great documentary. Needs to be longer!
A serious documentary about marine life around the Galapagos.  Well photographed and excellent production and clarity.
First off I'm a shark lover, so this was just icing on the cake for me to read about these gentle giant sharks. Definitely worth looking at or watching.
Too much like all the other documentaries I've seen on Whale Sharks.  Not much new or interesting.

Interesting documentary on the whale fish and their curious attraction to the Galpagos islands. I grew up watching National Geographic short films like these.  I learned a little bit, but mostly it just made me wanna go dicing there. Not a lot of info, but cool footage.
Not the most interesting documentary I have seen on whale sharks.  I watched about 20 to 25 minutes before I stopped it.
The film is basically a documentry on sharks and especially the huge and elusive whale sharks.  Lots of spectacular underwater photography.
It was five star quality but too short. The footage and narrative were amazingly done. Add thirty minutes of content for the fifth star.  This should be on everyone's list.
I found this documentary very informative. And is visually appealing to watch. It's just a beautiful film
Great Movie! While touching briefly on all creatures of Galapagos. Focuses primarily on the Whale Shark.
It was well done. Good narration and very informative
I did not watch the entire video as there was a storm and my internet was interrupted.  I will watch it again soon, but right now do not have the time.
So awesome and very educational. I am sure I will watch it again and again. This gave me a glimpse into a very rare and private world.

Viewing this film brings into question Darwin's evolutionary thought with creationists conviction of the ongoing debate of the Supreme. Everyone should make time to take the journey with one of nature's creation. A good documentary that grasps your attention.
It was very good there all ways some thing new you can learn about nature thanks
Great cinematography but not much of a story.

Beautiful and very educational to watch.  Highly recommend it. For older kids to adults.  Children that can handle understand the fish industry where people are trying to protect it for years to come, but there are also people that don't pay attention to preserving an industry for all future generations.  Again highly educational including a research team tracking and tagging whales for research purposes.
I love this. It's a real documentary, not a crappy pretend reality show on sharks.

Worh the money! Kids liked it.
Very colorful and gives allot of good info about the oxen and its animals. Great Sting music too
Not as well done as I had expected.
Never knew that they existed.  I recommend viewing to anyone interested in ocean life.
An OK shark adventure with very good filming
Average documentary. Not bad, but nothing special either.
Informative and interesting watch, I love watching them swim
We need nature in our lives, we are nature.
Great shots.  Tagging whale sharks is a breeze compared to free diving to tag hammerheads!

So Cool. Creatures I never knew existed. Great documentary with fabulous photography and interesting data collections. It is great to get a look at the small fish, hugging the giant fish to escape from the medium fish. So different than what you expect. These docile and amazing creatures share our planet.
I love whale sharks and always want to learn more about these amazingly beautiful gentle giants! Great footage and narrative.
Definitely some cool footage but a little disjointed. I've seen better. But for an enjoyable nature "tour," it's a good watch.
Probably picked a bad time to watch it, but it couldn't hold my attention.
It was good. Picture quality was very good
My 9 and 6 year old kids were enthralled, great show! They now want to visit the Galapagos, but that's a different story ;)
Visually stunning and the narration was great too
Enjoyed the video Greatly.  I would love to do the trip & dive but it won't be in this life time.
The video seems to be made mostly from a photographer's view. There is too little content to satisfy me.
Just great is all that needs to be said!!!!!!!
Great photography, but loud music at wrong times during narrative!
Absolutely fascination and keeps your attention during the whole presentation.
Great footage of the mystical Galapagos Island!!! Very well narrated and beautiful HD footage!!!
Spectacular imagery of these immense creatures.

The photography was very realistic like you were under the ocean with the whales and sharks. I learned a great deal about the migration of the species very educational and fascinating. I recommend this documentary for the whole family!
This documentary just did not keep my interest
It's mesmerizing with awesome camera effect, brilliant shot!  I enjoyed watching this!
Interesting to see the animals in such numbers and in their own environment.
Very interesting.  Not all sharks are man-eaters!
Good information on migratory patterns of whale sharks

A wonderfully documented film of the sea life around the Galapagos Islands.  I've read reviews that gave this film poor ratings because they believed the filmed "moved too slow". These are, of course, critiques from people whose film experience go no further than than watching the "flavor-of-the-month superhero flick".

This film is beautifully captured and flows at a pace that allows the viewer to absorb the information about these gentle giants. Wonderfully filmed and produced.  I totally recommend it.
Ocean life is always very interesting!
Documentary had fantastic video but had a weak story to tell. Sometimes too redundant.
My 11 year old son and my wife watched this. He said it was very good and he liked it.
Great documents to watch. My 9 yr. Old daughter enjoyed watching too.
My husband watched this and told me it was interesting, he enjoyed watching about tracking sharks.
Not impressed. There are better whale shark documentaries.
I really like it. It was very informative.
Enjoyable, Informative, but should have been longer
This is a great educational look at some incredible fish.
Great movie, good cinematography and great info
A must see! Just gorgeous and intriguing!
Very well put together documentary. The scenery is fantastic.
Good show. Sounded like the old PBS shows- in a great way! Informative level was good with condescending or over reaching.
The tagging aspect went a little long. I very much enjoyed the shots of the beautiful whale sharks.
very interesting I must say I do enjoy nature and I plan to watch many more of this type programs in the future on prime I highly recommend this item

A most beautiful and enjoyable documentary.  The Galapagos Islands are mysterious and beautiful, but what is under the water is beyond description.  The footage of the underwater scenes with the whale sharks took my breath away!  I'm so very grateful for the men and women who are studying the whale shark, a magnificent creature!  I highly recommend this documentary.
I love seeing movies like this one that are looking into these amazing fish that our we still do not know very much about. We should have more of  these movies.

This is a quality documentary for the whole family about the whale sharks. A fascinating
look into the lives of these gentle giants, their lives and place in the sea ecosystem.
I would recommend this any time any day for everyone!
Cool documentary about a species we know little about.
I've personally experienced swimming with Whale Sharks so I know what magical and majestic creatures they are.  Beautiful photography and great insight on the known data about their habits.
For an amazing place like Galapagos, I found this move quite boring...  :(
Although I have seen alot of documentaries that include Whale Sharks, I never understood the size of these creatures until seeing this video.
Very educational. My 4 year old loves sharks and this was appropriate for him.
I really enjoyed this movie. It is very informative and the images on here are outstanding.
Reminded me of those excellent National Geographic documentaries I used to watch with my dad.
Interesting but thin on details. Seemed repetitive.
Magnificent quality and an incredible story!

Great quality picture and superb footage.  Very relaxing to watch.  It was amazing to see the number of hammerhead sharks schooling at times and the sheer size of the whale sharks is incredible to see.
One of the best ocean documentaries I've seen. No hype, a research expedition with a clear goal. Beautiful footage.
Great resolution, looked great on the 70in UHD tv.
We are never disappointed with anything concerning The Galapago Islands EXCEPT the number of humans there.
Love documentaries like this. Whale sharks have always fascinated me. I was amazed that we still know so little about them.
Exceptionally well done if you like oceanographic films
Suppose to be a documentary on whale sharks. From beginning to end it's mentioned that not much is known about whale sharks.
Loved the graphics and streaming of this video.

It's got pretty pictures, that's for sure. The narration was kind of robotic and underwritten, but not bad enough to get me to stop watching. The reason I couldn't finish this is the soundtrack. Every underwater scene seemed to have two or more synthesizer tracks playing at independent tempos. Beats didn't line up, chords were all over the place. It was so unpleasant and distracting, I tried turning the sound off. Then I just turned the movie off.
I had no idea.  Really enjoyed the presentation.
Amazing. I love to dive and this is the next best thing!
Very interesting takes you to places that you will probably never be
So interesting. I never knew about whale sharks!
Beautiful camera work and information conveyed in a way that really keeps your attention (not boring)
This was a very informative documentary on whale sharks. I learned ma by things I never knew before.
Was a great show to watch with the kids.
Loved it learned loads!!  Excellent photography.
Narrator was difficult to hear over music
Very interesting. Beautiful live video.  Outstanding doc.
Fascinating creatures. We enjoyed the cinematography and the narrative. I could relive my dive days.
Wasn't as informative as I would have liked.
Perfect for information or a something to relax to on a cold rainy day.

Beautifully shot and excellent narrative. An insightful view of the gentle giants that are the whale sharks, describing habits, migration, reproduction and the endangered species status they held and why . Love it!
Excellent! Very well inform, and beautifully fimed too.
Beautifully captured the thrilling, unique flora, fauna of this wonderful. as yet unspoiled. special place on our planet.
Very interesting and informative program that I enjoyed watching.
I enjoyed this movie very much. It was very informative.
Good but not great! But then just finished watching the blue planet!
Interesting topic but production could have been better
Sort of " old school " in presentation
Now I just love these documentaries and this one is just awesome
Didn't realize it was apparently filmed in 1992.
Loved it and learned a great deal!
loved it watched it with my twelve year old son. Very educational....
Very interesting. U,C.Davis was involved and we just saw our granddaughter  at U.C.Davis.
Beautiful photography for an interesting subject----polkadotted whale sharks...never knew anything about them.
Loved the  diving pictures...Very cool!! If you're a scuba diver you'll love this show!
Great show on the Galapagos and the following of the whale sharks and their habits.
Will put you to sleep if you need a nap.
Well done, great insights into the natural world normally hidden from view.
Exceptional film of exploring whale sharks. Beautifully filmed. Full of first time information.
Excellent movie. We've been to Galapagos twice and it was exciting to see some of the same places we visited. Great photography. Suitable for the family
Fascinating and informative.  Would recommend it.

Very enjoyable show, great scenery and a good way to learn about different spices of sharks .
Thanks
Liked everything but at times the narrator was drowned out by ambient noise.

It was very interesting, I watched it with my granddaughter, we were both very interested in the giant sharks. We didn't know what they existed, It was a very well done piece, great for young kids to see
I admire the courage and dedication of those divers that spent their life studying those Giants.
interesting, not overwhelmingly so... but, not bad
Loved it.  LOved seeing Jonathan Green.  he was part of our expedition to Antarctica and was fantastic,,
Great short documentary to watch just before bed. Beautiful, calm, etc. Some interesting research brought up too.
Very interesting.  Howevery a little repetitive.
Bit dated whale sharks study, tagging, some closeups, a mass of hammerhead sharks, no interactions or analysis on this documentary.
It was interesting to learn about the whale sharks. The effort they are going to find were the whale sharks are having their babies.

Anything regarding the Galapagos is fascinating these giant whales sharks included. This is a nice relaxing movie to watch before bed. These fellows feed on microscopic food so it is not a "Jaws" type but but a relaxing movie. Enjoy!
Amazing show.  Loved it and I have a ton of respect for the men and women who study wildlife to help us preserve them.
Watched more than once. Well done.
There are many documentaries that I do like, but after listening to ten minutes of narration, and not what the people on camera were actually saying, it got very boring.

was fairly interesting but seemed a little dated.  Not a lot of really new information but was interesting as it was filmed well and was showing scenes of that area you probably may not have seen before.
Nice underwater shots....more on the area in the beginning and the migration details would be helpful
I love seeing God's creation. The awesomeness of how He made these massive animals and how they survive and swim for miles is beyond belief!
It was great! My girls learned a lot.
Educational, excellent documentary about an ancient giant we know very little about.
Lots of scuba diving and fish/sharks.
Love the whalesharks, would like to have seen more tortiouses.

Watched this visually stunning program with my family. Wished there was a little more educational element to it but seeing as there is so much more we need to learn about this huge fish I am hoping to see Realm of the Giant Sharks II.
Very interesting.  A bit slow moving

As a scuba diver I am prejudiced in favor of anything about our underwater world.  This film was nicely done and true to life.  It put all the emphasis on the animals rather than the human "stars."  I would recommend it for anyone wanting to know more about these gentle giants and this unique part of the world.
Never knew about these sharks. Informative documentary.
Pretty good. New stuff every few minutes. Brave people ...fun to view.
Incredibly informative without sensationalism. Great photography. Well worth the time of anyone interested in the actual life of the oceans even as mankind does its best to screw them up.
I dove with the same dive company and crew in 2007, felt like I was right there diving with the Whale Sharks again! The Galpagos Islands truly are amazing!
Was very good info but drug out in spots but is the nature of documentaries
Not amazing but was interesting.  Shark or nature lovers will enjoy it.
Over all good, but tends to jump around a bit.....and it would be nice to see more of were the sharks are going after they are tagged!
Very well filming of true nature. Very informative and kept me watching

A wonderful insight into one of the most amazing animals on our planet.
  I got to see one in the Atlanta aquarium; I cried.
An excellent show. Very informative, not at all dry or boring.
Visually exciting, very interesting and educational.
Wonderful photography, easy to follow narrative and overall very interesting and informative.
Best documentary about Whale Sharks I have ever seen !!
Beautiful photography/videography, awesome subject...great information on the whale sharks. Will watch again.
Please included more of this type of program
It was an amazing look at the whale sharks off the Galapagos as well as a look at a few other local creatures.
Totally awesome! Unbelievable animals, to be so docile and yet so large. Very well documented.
Nice but the picture quality didn't work that well on our service.
Didn't know anything about the Galapagos.  Was fascinated  with the information this video  gave me.
Love these documentaries. Very interesting and informative about giants if the ocean.
Yeah the whale shark is interesting for about 15 minutes, then blah.
Learned nothing,felt like the movie was not finished. Maybe if they waited until the research was completed
Great show. Worth watching. amazing camera work
Boring with mediocre photography! A disappointment for a National Geographic production. Felt like more propaganda than anything.
Good shots of the whale sharks and other marine life, but there was a weird audio sound throughout the film that sound like muffled snow crunching.

I like to watch nature show.
It's amazing to watch how more and more information becomes available about the lives of these animals.

Disappointing.  The sound was poorly mixed so that the necessary volume for dialogue made the background music way too loud.  The overall presentation seemed low budget and kind of boring.  I'm sorry because we love nature shows.  But this didn't capture any of our attention for very long.
NatGeo is great about giving us spectacular documentaries.
not bad. not as good as Attenborough's "Blue Planet: Seas of Life"
I enjoy learning about other places in our big world that I will probably never have the opportunity to visit.
Great visuals, some facts were off.
If you are a shark junky...enjoy

Research into giant whale sharks and their migratory and birth paths (about which relatively little is known).  An interesting presentation which serves to heighten awareness of these giant creatures while also recognizing how little we know about much of the vast oceans of our planet.
I enjoyed this film very much. Great scenery and new facts revealed to me about sea life and vast ocean.
I think some of the information could have been a little more in depth, but this was a beautiful film.
I thought it was very interesting with great cinematography
Fascinating and well done. Enjoyed watching.
Superb introduction to the mystique of the Galapagos.
Spectacular, nature in action in a watery habitat
It's ok.  The commentary is a little ho-hum, but there were some new interesting facts for us.  Not bad, just now great.
Kept my interest to the end
It was interesting and a a nice fyi...
Great topic, such a poor delivery. Boring as hell

Excellent photography of HUGE sharks.  Can't wait for the next one in the series!  The tags on the whale sharks reveal movement patterns that provide a new clue to their life history.  We think fish live near the surface, where we see them, but I can't wait to see where they go.  Sharks don't have a swim bladder, so they can dive without it blowing up as they move from deep water to near the surface.
Showed it to my 6th grade students. They really enjoyed it.  Not fast moving so long their attention after a while.
Seeing the 300 offspring at differing developmental stages inside a female SAS incredible.
Loved how it was determined that the whales travel based on food supply and birthing.  The audio video quality along with the content was impressive. Great documentary!

This is a beautifully photographed film about tracking whale sharks that gather in the Galapagos islands.
My only nit to pick is that I wanted to know more about the changing currents the divers encountered.
But that question itself shows that the film was engaging.
I expect to watch this a second time.
The natural shots are worth every minute of it.
Sorry, was hoping more on giant sharks and not about nurse sharks. Yes, they are giants, but very boring giants
Very interesting and insightful. My grand kids loved it also.
We liked this so much we cried. We felt sorry for the plankton. We added a photo of our dog.
Pretty amazing area.  I have dove all over the world and would love to go to this area.
I really liked it, it was very interesting.

Was not quite sure of the overall purpose, and how effective the methodology was.  A number of assumptions about tagging (lost tags, etc) were unexplained or glossed over.  Some additional detail on how the tags worked, what specific data was collected, and how you could determine of tags were lost or otherwise made inoperative.  Just got the impression of a film put together as justification for an expensive research trip.
Having been to the Galapagos I found this to be very entertaining. Diving in this area is a true adventure.
It was a fun informative watch. Very interesting and clean fun.
Not very exciting. Nothing new.  Same as many other docs
Hihgly recommended if you like marine life and galapagos islands. Beatiful video!
Great filming in a natural environment. Good documentary
Great document to learn and explore into the amazing oceans
Very informative film that covers allot of interesting material about our ocean life below.
You feel wondered as to how planet earth is diverse and life thrives
It was very informative and interesting.
Great video of whale sharks.  Informative and up to date.
I didn't care for this program
Great images and storyline only view in HD not HDR
It's an awesome documentary - I am obsessed with as many animal docs I can watch and this was nice and informative! Whale sharks are one of those amazing animals I love to learn about!
It was very informative. The under water scenes were great.
Repeated a lot of the same info.... some interesting facts but not so entertaining
It was impressive to see the beauty of these graceful animals.
I expected more coverage of the island's inhabitants.
Amazing camera work. Was more intrigued by the color and clarity of the sea than the subject matter. Definitely worth watching.
Was not interested in this at all...
So thankful for documentaries like this because we would never have a chance to see for ourselves!
Great documentary but seemed to drag on  at some parts.
Great picture quality and information about whale sharks, but the commentary was painfully boring.
Interesting story. I did not know that these creature actually existed. The images are great!
We found this by accident and were so happy we did!  Really interesting and the photography was outstanding!
Interesting new information plus lots of great footage.
Was okay - a bit on the boring side. Too much focus on the 'tagging process'.
Beautiful under sea filming. Really informative narration, keeps you engaged !!! One of the best  !!

What lies beneath the surface of the oceans is fascinating. We may never know all the mysteries of the oceans, but this documentary is amazing. I was hoping to see a whale shark give birth, but still a great job these brave people go through to tag these majestic creatures of the ocean. Well done!!!!
I usually love nature documentaries but this was just okay. It was rather long winded and I found myself losing interest.
I Liked watching  the program.  Missed it when it was on TV
This story was fascinating. The information about the currents around the Galapagos is far from common knowledge!
The cinematography was great and the narration informative. If you like sharks and aquatic films, this is one you should check out.
The coolest thing about whale sharks is that they are both whales and sharks. Whale sharks!
Extremely interesting. Just the thought of getting to know more about sea life. Especially one as big as a whale shark.(the gentle giant)
Excellent introduction of the beauty and docile behavior of the seas largest and by far one of the oldest fish of the sea. Hopefully there will be a documentary sequel.
Film has great takes but give you very few info. If you watch it you will conclude, we do not know anything about whalesharks
interesting to learn about the whale sharks.  a straight forward film that keeps it's focus on a small area and singular purpose.  good film!
Exceptional insight for a marine species that was previously least studied.  Outstanding film and narrative for this study of the majestic whale shark that is very well done.
Very interesting.  My daughter and I finally agreed on something to watch.
It was informative but not exceptional.
Great documentary about a place I probably won't visit. So, good to go there in the video.
Great photography and very relevant information. My son was completely engrossed and now wants to dive
I love the quality of this film
Great information about these wonderful creatures!
Alright but seems like an older documentary.
I love the life of the underwater world.
Interesting and fun. Picture was good and in high def
Very interesting.  Love to learn about nature. Still wished I knew how they know to go there.
It was a very beautifully produced show.  The narration and video were wonderful.
Great camera angles; truly breathtaking.. A must see for nature buffs.
It was interesting to see these sharks up close and learn the habits that we know of.
Wonderful submarine pictures, very interesting content
beautiful movie so sad we killing all the wonders of our planet
Great phootage, narative and information. Loved watching real science at work in such an amazing place.
Good narrative and commentary on the Whale Shark.
Very interesting video. Amazing animals.  Definitely worth watching.

This was a good intro for people that have never seen the Whale Sharks before.
Gentle giants !
An excellent documentary on whale sharks that captures their beauty and how little we really know about them.
Great documentary.  Who would have known these sharks can carry 300 babies at one time !
Surprisingly good for a low budget documentary. Great underwater cinematography in a great place.
Good-looking documentary, but it suffered from poor pacing and a lack of focus. My 7-year-old is a fiend for nature documentaries, but this one just couldn't hold his attention
I could watch this one over and over.  It's a beautiful video
Most everything was translated and not as interesting as other shark shows.
Amazing footage of marine life and excellent information on sharks

Fascinating documentary about the largest shark species - the Whale Shark. I will watch this again and again. A high quality, educational, enlightening look at an animal that most of us will never be able to see first hand. A wonderful film.

This had some beautiful film footage and was a great introduction to the mysterious majestic whale shark. The one scientist has an excellent way with words and spoke very poetically of what he saw and did. My father, a biology professor at Ohio State University, saw the film with me and also enjoyed it.
It was ok not as big a thrill as I thought It would be

Great video for anyone who is interested in the islands of the Galapagos, whale sharks , marine life, or just the beauty of the cinematography. Well done and will keep you interested . Two thumbs up .
Interesting exploration of a phenomenal creation!!!
Really nice video of these massive creatures, but I found it hard to watch because the music, and other audio bites over powered the narration too much.

How little we see the beauty that is before us.  I hope to visit these places someday.  Thanks to all those who took time in creating this film, and to those that have been taking care of the treasures we have so the next generation can still witness them.

This was an odd production with more about the divers waiting and broken equipment with poor sound production often overshadowing the narration to the point of distraction. The sharks are fascinating but are not very present in the documentary itself.
Dont waste your time. Spoiler alert: they don't know anymore at the end of the movie than they do at the beginning.

I never knew that these majestic creatures were actually a species of seal, and that their primary source of food was Orca and Great White Sharks. Truly fascinating. Their migration across the great Canadian Plains is a marvel to behold, and was only recently captured on film.

This is documentary about a failed trip to learn nothing about sharks they know little about and left knowing less.  I challenge anyone who watches this to tell me one thing about these sharks this group of scientists learned during this documentary's expedition.  As an avid fan of anything Galapagos, the only thing remarkable about this is how one can spend time there and come away with no new knowledge.
Loved this documentary!  So beautifully filmed.

People need to watch this documentary.  It is a true understanding about what is going on in our oceans and how individual cultures still believe eating sharks is acceptable given the environmental instability that exists.

As we change our planet, we, as humans...all humans, must change as well. Period.
Without balance, conservation, and an environmental ethic....we cannot rely on our past traditions to continue as usual.
Amazing footage and fascinating study of giant sharks.
